snippet: The purchase of shares owned by the chief executive would be the conglomerate’s first acquisition of a maker of luxury goods based in Germany....
abstract: LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton say it is acquiring its first German luxury brand, luggage company Rimowa, and will purchase controlling stake in manufacturer for 640 million euros or about $719 million.

byline.original: By CHAD BRAY and ELIZABETH PATON
byline.contributor: Chad Bray reported from London, and Elizabeth Paton from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The purchase of shares owned by the chief executive would be the conglomerate’s first acquisition of a maker of luxury goods based in Germany.

headline.main: LVMH to Take 80% Stake in German Luggage Brand Rimowa
headline.print_headline: Luxury Conglomerate to Add German Luggage Brand

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton SA
